content:
Sure, here's the will as it was before any of the changes were made:

LAST WILL AND TESTAMENT OF ROSALYNN MCCLENAGAN

I, Rosalynn McClenagan, being of sound mind and body, do hereby make, publish and declare this to be my Last Will and Testament, hereby revoking all prior wills and codicils made by me at any time heretofore.

ARTICLE I

I appoint Warren McClenagan as the executor of this will. If Warren McClenagan does not survive me, I appoint Brian McClenagan as the alternate executor.

ARTICLE II

I direct my executor to pay all of my just debts, funeral expenses, and expenses of administering my estate, as soon after my death as is reasonably practical.

ARTICLE III

I give, devise, and bequeath all of my tangible personal property, including household items, keepsakes, photo albums, and any pets that may be in my care at the time of my death to my sons Warren McClenagan, Brian McClenagan, and Benjamen McClenagan, in equal shares, to be divided among them as they shall agree.

ARTICLE IV

I give, devise, and bequeath all of my right, title, and interest in the following property to my sons Warren McClenagan, Brian McClenagan, and Benjamen McClenagan, in equal shares, to be divided among them as they shall agree:

(A) My annuity;

(B) My home, worth approximately $120,000 and owned outright;

(C) My life insurance policy;

(D) My car, worth approximately $11,000;

(E) One-third (1/3) of my section of farmland.

ARTICLE V

In the event that any of my sons predecease me, his share shall pass to his surviving children, in equal shares, to be divided among them as they shall agree.

ARTICLE VI

If any beneficiary named in this will contests this will, any share or interest in my estate given to that person by this will shall be forfeited and shall become part of my residuary estate.

ARTICLE VII

I direct that any taxes levied against my estate shall be paid from my residuary estate.

ARTICLE VIII

All the rest, residue, and remainder of my property of every kind and description, wheresoever situated, including any property over which I may have a power of appointment at the time of my death, and which I have not otherwise effectively disposed of by this will or by any other means during my lifetime, I give, devise, and bequeath to my sons Warren McClenagan, Brian McClenagan, and Benjamen McClenagan, in equal shares, to be divided among them as they shall agree.

ARTICLE IX

I nominate, constitute, and appoint my sons Warren McClenagan, Brian McClenagan, and Benjamen McClenagan as the guardians of any minor children I may have at the time of my death.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this \_\_\_\_ day of \_\_\_\_\_\_***, 20***.

---

Rosalynn McClenagan
